#summary Useful tidbits learned about RTAI.

= Introduction =

The page is meant to keep track of ideas, links, notes, etc. regarding RTAI and its setup.


= Details =
The Linux Journal has an overview ([http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/232 1], [http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/5742 2], [http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/5904 3]) of Linux real-time systems and a comparison of real-time packages.


RTAI Compatible Hardware:
  * May need to use Redhat Linux to install meIII software, because of the RPM files.
  * RTAI/Linux the Measurement Instrument cards in the lab: PCI-DDA08/12 and PCI-DAS1602/12.  You can find the full list of supported measurement hardware, including NI cards, [http://www.comedi.org/hardware.html here].
  * Interesting [http://forums.ni.com/ni/board/message?board.id=280&thread.id=967 thread] on NI forum on issues to consider when adding hardware to RTAI.

Plausible Redhat Linux install [https://www.rtai.org/RTAILAB/RTAI-TARGET-HOWTO.txt instructions] from rtai.org.
